intro: Haploclathra leiantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Haploclathra leiantha is adapted to coastal and lowland habitats, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
